data.title: The Great Gildersleeve (1942)

data.text:
RKO Radio Pictures

Starring: Harold Peary, Jane Darwell, Freddie Mercer

Directed by: Gordon Douglas

Synopsis: Based on the long-running radio comedy series. In an attempt to help their uncle Throckmorton P. Gildersleeve (Harold Peary) avoid the advances of Judge Hooker’s (Charles Arnt) sister, Leroy (Freddie Mercer) and Marjorie (Nancy Gates) try to build him up as a great man about town.

Kitty Cameo: Hoping to secure his guardianship of his niece and nephew, Gildersleeve asks their Aunt Emma (Jane Darwell) to stay with them. This displaces Gildersleeve to sleep on a cot in the basement. As he prepares to retire, a tabby cat is sitting on a cushion above the bed.

Gildersleeve forgets to turn off the light before he lies down and the cord is so short he can’t reach it.

In reaching for the cord the cot slips and falls. The cat watches as Gildersleeve gets down on the floor to fix it.

While Gildersleeve is beneath the cot, the cat crawls into his sleeping bag. When Gildersleeve gets back in bed he thinks the bag is fur-lined. Ginger, their dog, jumps on the bed and licks Gildersleeve’s face. Gildersleeve then puts the dog into the bag and comedy ensues (the cat is not seen again in the film).

Final Mewsings: Gildersleeve should have just let the cat out of the bag!
